Academic Commons

The Willamette University Academic Commons contains online collections from the Willamette University Archives and the Hallie Ford Museum of Art in addition to other digital collections supported by the Hatfield Library.

The Willamette University Community Collections are home to undergraduate theses, student grants and awards documents, faculty business records, data sets and other collections.

Regional History

Founded in 1842, Willamette University played an important role in the history of the Oregon Territory and the State of Oregon.

Much of this regional history is documented in the collections of the Willamette University Archives and the Hallie Ford Museum of Art. Important collections include the Pacific Northwest Artists Archive, the Congressional and Political Papers, and the Northwest and the Native American Art Collections. Other collections document events and daily life.

Willamette University

The story of Willamette University is embodied by generations of faculty, staff and especially students.

You can explore this rich history in University Archives collections. These include the Willamette Collegian newspaper (1875-present) and the Wallulah yearbook (1903-1998). Campus photographs and postcard collections document campus life and the physical environment from 1869 to the present. Willamette's Freshman Glee tradition is recorded in sound, images and documents from Glee's 75-year history.

Beyond Willamette and Region

Over the decades, Willamette University friends and alumni have been governors, legislators, artists, teachers, soldiers and peacemakers.

Papers, diaries, letters and photographs in University Archives Collections document a foreign correspondent in Europe, a soldier's experience in the American Civil War, artists whose interests and influence reached beyond the region, and leaders who crafted national legislation as documented in the Congressional and Political Papers. Images from the Hallie Ford Museum of Art digital collections span continents and centuries of art history.
